story.title: The Christmas Sweater - Episode 8
story.storyDescription: Ever since her mother’s death, Noelle hasn’t wanted to go home for the holidays. But perhaps a bit of holiday magic is all she needs…
story.creator: web-uploader
story.postPaywallNotification: Noelle just laid out her soul for Lawrence—will he take it? Tap back into THE CHRISTMAS SWEATER to find out.
story.prePaywallNotification: Will Noelle find love with Lawrence? ❤️❤️ Read the conclusion of THE CHRISTMAS SWEATER.

messages.text: Noelle throws open the door to the bookshop.
She shouts into the dark, open space.
Lawrence!
Lawrence, are you here?
Lawrence steps out from the back room, holding a handful of books.
Noelle? I thought that was you earlier.
Why did you run?
Because…it’s kind of what I do.
I get scared and I run.
And it’s something I really need to work on.
Lawrence reaches out his arm.
Noelle, it’s okay…
It really isn’t. I want to start trusting myself with relationships. Maybe with…
You?
Lawrence starts walking toward Noelle.
I think that could be arranged.
His steps slow, but he keeps moving closer.
It sounds like it’s going to take some practice, though.
Lawrence takes two more slow steps, and then he’s inches away from Noelle.
She feels her pulse pound.
Her stomach lurches, demanding one thing…
Run.
Noelle…
She feels herself flush, but stands her ground…
Because she’s never wanted anyone to kiss her this desperately.
Then…as if reading the desire in her eyes…
Lawrence presses his soft mouth against hers.
And it feels like home.
Lawrence breaks the kiss and chuckles.
That wasn’t so bad, was it?
No…it wasn’t bad…
But I might need to do it again to be sure.
And she leans in for another kiss…
As Beatrice walks into the room, stumbling upon them by mistake.
But neither of them notices as their lips lock into a long, passionate kiss.
Beatrice smiles knowingly at the magic of her favorite Christmas sweater.
One week later
A priest is standing in front of Noelle’s dad and Beatrice…
When he requests that they seal their commitment to one another with a kiss.
In a sudden display of youthful love…
Noelle’s dad dips Beatrice down and kisses her soundly on the lips.
Her leg kicks out of her neatly pressed white sheath suiting dress.
And the crowd lets out a whopping cheer.
In her pine green bridesmaid dress, Noelle meets Lawrence in the aisle.
They recess out together in front of the newlyweds.
Lawrence leans over to whisper in Noelle’s ear.
I’ve never seen my aunt so happy.
She’s always wanted this, you know.
Wait, what?
A family.
Shrugging, Noelle smiles.
But Beatrice has always been family.
Lawrence squeezes her arm tightly.
Noelle looks around, taking in the special wedding details.
Everything is perfect.
They’re at the Martingale Wharf — right on the water.
And as luck would have it, there was a light dusting of snow the night before…
Covering the ground in sparkles.
The Christmas lights are up, and everything is shining.
Noelle grabs her place card from the table and glances at Lawrence’s simultaneously.
Look! We’re seated at Table Two together.
That’s too bad. Sounds like they gave us a good table.
Laughing, Noelle gives him a questioning look.
And why is it a bad thing to sit at a good table?
Because we won’t be in our seats.
Don’t expect to leave the dance floor tonight.
The trumpets sound and Noelle’s dad glides into the room with Beatrice on his arm.
They dance to a peppy first song, and then invite other couples to join them.
Lawrence takes Noelle’s hand and leads her to the middle of the dance floor.
And it doesn’t take more than two steps before he’s spinning her like a pro.
Her skirt flares out like the bottom of a bell.
She can’t help but laugh.
They dance for what feels like hours, until the lead singer stops the music to make an announcement.
He calls all the single ladies up to the front of the dance floor.
It’s time to throw the bouquet…
Maria grabs her wrist.
Let’s go!
They rush over to the center of the dance floor.
After a group gathers, Beatrice launches her bouquet in the air…
And it lands directly in Maria’s hands.
Noelle claps with glee.
I knew it! I knew you’d be the next one to get married!
Hey! Don’t jinx it, remember?
Noelle rolls her eyes, smiling all the while.
Yeah yeah yeah.
Tom scoops Maria up in his arms and the two share a passionate kiss.
A slow, familiar melody fills the air, and Noelle feels a tap on her shoulder.
She turns and Lawrence bows before her dramatically, holding out his hand.
May I have this dance, my lady?
Yes, you may, sir.
The two lovebirds glide to the rhythm for a few moments.
The only sounds between them are the soothing notes of the song.
Until finally, Noelle finds the courage to amplify the moment with a whisper.
You’re a good wedding date, you know.
Lawrence smiles.
I’m glad you think so.
Because I hope to always be your date.
For many more weddings to come.
